intro: Portea gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's portea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
